message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with a protocol for secure distributed summation, which is a topic in cryptography (cs.CR). The protocol involves shuffling, which is a technique used in distributed systems (cs.DS). The analysis of the protocol involves information theory (cs.IT) and statistical inference (cs.LG). Finally, the paper is relevant to the emerging field of differential privacy (cs.SI), as it proposes a method to achieve privacy guarantees in the shuffle model.
